src_text: Kabinete e kopane ka Laboraro, 5 Manthole 2018 mo Tuynhuys ka Motsekap Merero Ye Bohlokwa Seemong Sa Bjale1.
trg_text: Cabinet met on Wednesday, 5 December 2018 at Tuynhuys in Cape Town Issues in the environment1.

src_text: Kgolo ya ekonomiKabinete e amogela kgolo ya 2,2% mo ekonoming ya Afrika Borwa nakong ya kotara ya boraro, yeo e thu ago go nt ha naga maemong a fasefase a ekonom Dibopego t a kgolo di hlohleledit we ke kgolo ka lekaleng la temo (), lekala la dit helete (); lekala la t welet o () le lekala la mabenkelekgoparara le dikgwebjana t a ditheki o le papat o ().
trg_text: using green energ It will be supported by mixed services such as warehousing and logistic This forms part of is the Maputo Development Corridor project, which is a major trade corridor which connects Gauteng, Limpopo and Mpumalanga with Maputo in Mozambiqu It comprises, among other things, roads, ports and railwayIt will contribute towards accelerating growth, attract foreign and domestic direct investment, expand the manufacturing sector and create employment in the regio Cabinet has approved the signing of the rollover Economic Partnership Agreement (EPA) with the United Kingdom (UK) once the last outstanding technical issues are resolved and the internal administrative issues are finalise

src_text: Dibopego t a kgolo di bont ha go kaonafala ga ekonomi gomme mmogo le mananeo go t wa go Samiti ya Me omo le Khonferense ya Dipeelet o ya Afrika Borwa, di tla t wela pele go kaonafalKabinete e na le maAfrika Borwa mo go amogeleng go fokot ega ga ditheko t a dibe wa t eo e lego kimollo, kudu ka ge re lebile nakong ya makhut
trg_text: The NMW will immediately benefit more than six million workers and help address the level of inequality and poverty in South Afric This landmark proclamation will extend our social net to the most vulnerable peopl International Anti-Corruption DayIn commemoration of the UN s International Anti-Corruption Day on Sunday, 9 December 2018, Cabinet reaffirms the country s fight against corruption in both the private and public sector The JCPS Cluster has prioritised the fight against this scourge in line with government s zero-tolerance stance towards corruptio Corruption is a societal problem that must be fought by everyone as it hinders socio-economic development and increases poverty by diverting resources away from where they are most neede

src_text: Makala ka moka a set haba a kgopelwa go aga mo moyeng wo mobotse nakong ya kotara ya boraro go thu a go bea ekonomi ya Afrika Borwa tseleng ya kgolo ye mpsha Moputso wa Fasefase wa Set haba (NMW)Kabinete e amoget e gape go saennwa ga Molaokakanywa wa NMW go ba molao ke Mopresidente Cyril Ramaphos Molaokakanywa o dira mohlala wa histori mo go t hirelet eng ba omi bao ba amogelago moputso wa fase le phokot o ya go se lekalekane mo set haben NMW ya mathomo e tla godi a meputso ya tekanyet o ya dimilione t e tshela t a ba omi bao ba amogelago moputso wa fase ba Afrika Borw Go tla ba le nako ya phethagat o ya ba omi ba dipolaseng, ba omi ba dithokgeng le ba omi ba ka gaLe ge NMW ye e ka se fedi e go se lekalekane, Kabinete e kgolwa gore e
trg_text: The growth figures signal a rebound in the economy and together with initiatives from the Jobs Summit and South African Investment Conference, will continue to improvCabinet also joins South Africans in welcoming this month s drop in the fuel price which comes as a relief, especially as we move into a holiday perio All sectors of society are urged to build on the positive momentum during the third quarter to help place the South African economy on a new growth trajectory National Minimum Wage (NMW)Cabinet also welcomes the signing of the NMW Bill into law by President Cyril Ramaphos The Bill sets a historic precedent in the protection of low-earning workers and reduction of inequality in societ The first NMW will raise the earnings of an estimated six million South African low-earning worker There will be a phase-in period for farm workers, forestry workers and domestic worker Whilst this NMW will not end income inequality, Cabinet believes it will go a long way to breaking the back of rising inequality and persistent poverty Toyota Wessels Institute for Manufacturing Studies (TWIMS)Cabinet welcomes the launch of the newly established R56-million TWIM The institute will boost South Africa s manufacturing sector, develop world-class capabilities and drive African industrialisatio It will also accelerate the building of a manufacturing culture that the country needs to drive its domestic demands and create more jobIt is an independent and not-for-profit initiative established through grant funding from the Toyota South Africa Education Trus It has been established in partnership with the University of Pretoria s Gordon Institute of Business Science to deliver a Master of Business Administration degree specialising in manufacturing Social EconomyCabinet notes the successful Symposium on the Social Economy held by government in partnership with the International Labour Organisation (ILO) and the Government of Flanders on Friday, 30 November 2018.

src_text: oma kudu go fokot a go se lekalekane mo go golago le bohloki bjoo bo t welago pele Institute ya Toyota Wessels ya Dithuto t a T welet o (TWIMS)Kabinete e amogela go thakgolwa ga TWIMS ye mpsha ya R56 milion Institute e tla thu a lekala la t welet o la Afrika Borwa, ya godi a bokgoni bja maemo a godimo le go hlahla tlhabollo ya diintasteri t a Afrik E tla akgofi a gape go agwa ga set o sa t welet o seo naga e sa nyakago go hlahla dinyakwa t a yona t a gae le go hlola me omo ye ment Ke lenaneo leo le ikemego gape la go se be le dipoelo leo le hlomilwego ka thekgo ya dit helete go t wa go Trasete ya Thuto ya Toyota ka Afrika Borw Le dirilwe ka tiri ano le Institute ya Kgwebo ya Disaense ya Gordon ya Yunibesithi ya Pretoria go aba tikrii ya Master of Business Administration yeo nepi ago t welet o Merero ya Mekgatlho ya LeagoKabinete e tsebisit e ka Simposiamo sa Merero ya Mekgatlho ya Leago seo se swerwego ka katlego seo se swerwego ke mmu o ka tiri ano le Mokgatlo wa Me omo wa Bodit habat haba (ILO) le Mmu o wa Flanders ka Labohlano, 30 Dibatsela 2018.
trg_text: The IMC will be supported by the approved establishment of the APRM National Governing Counci This APRM review process provides member states a space for national dialogue on governance and socio-economic indicators and an opportunity to build consensus on the way forwar Cabinet approved for South Africa to sign the Convention to establish, under international law, an intergovernmental organisation called the Square Kilometre Array (SKA) Observatory, which will be responsible for the construction and operational phases of the global SKA radio telescope project, to be located in South Africa and Australi The signing of the convention will be crucial in providing the global partnership with the appropriate governance mechanisms, which will ensure successful delivery of the projec South Africa will also be able to leverage foreign inward investment, as well as skills and infrastructure development benefits associated with the SKA projec Cabinet approved the One-Stop Border Post (OSBP) National Framework for implementatio This provides guidance towards the speedy establishment of OSBPs between South Africa and its neighboring countrie The OSBP will enhance trade facilitation without compromising national security or revenue collection through the efficient movement of goods, persons and services between South Africa and the adjoining states of Botswana, Lesotho, Namibia, Mozambique and Zimbabw It will also result in the region realising a faster border clearance and limited duplication of border agency interventions, which in turn improves trade competitiveness and movement of person by cutting down on cost and tim Cabinet approved that the National Treasury and Financial Intelligence Centre (FIC) will coordinate South Africa s preparation for the national risk assessment and upcoming mutual evaluation process which commences in mid-April 2019.

src_text: Simposiamo se be se etilwe pele ke Kgoro ya Tlhabollo ya Ekonomi e thekgilwe ke Kgoro ya Tlhabollo ya Dikgwebo t e DinnyanMerero ya Mekgatlho ya Leago e akaret a dikgwebo le mananeo ao a nepi ago dinepo t a dipholisi t a leago go swana le go hlola me omo, go amogela dihlopha t eo di se a akaret wago, le go tli a t e dibotse le ditirelo dit habeng t a magaen E na le bokgoni bja go thekga go akaret wa ga ekonomi le go hlola dikete t a me omo ya tlalelet
trg_text: The symposium was led by the Economic Development Department and supported by the Department of Small Business DevelopmenThe Social Economy comprises enterprises and initiatives directed at achieving social-policy objectives such as creating jobs, mainstreaming excluded groups, and bringing goods and services to rural communitie It has the potential of supporting economic inclusion and creating thousands of additional job The symposium brought together social entrepreneurs, policymakers, researchers and non-governmental organisations, and will help in the development of a Green Paper on the Social Economy during 201 Voter registrationIn preparation for the 2019 elections, Cabinet calls on South Africans to exercise their right as responsible citizens by ensuring they have a green bar-coded ID book, smart ID card or temporary identity certificate and are registered to vote in their district The Independent Electoral Commission will hold a voter-registration weekend on 26 and 27 January 2019 and South Africans are encouraged to use the opportunity to register to vote or verify their registration statu Cabinet appeals to those who have applied for Smart IDs to collect their documents at their respective Department of Home Affairs (DHA) branches National Director of Public Prosecutions (NDPP)Cabinet applauds President Ramaphosa s appointment of Advocate Shamila Batohi as the new NDP This follows the President s consideration of five nominees shortlisted by an advisory pane The appointment brings stability to the leadership of the National Prosecuting Authority and emboldens the country s fight against crime and corruptio

src_text: Mopresidente Ramaphosa o tsebi it e Ngwaga wa 2018 bjalo ka ngwaga wa segopot o sa Mandel Bohwa bja gagwe bo ketikilwe ngwaga ka moka ke maAfrika Borwa ka dibopego t a wona t a go fapana, ya kgauswanyana e lego Global Citizen Festival Mandela 100 mo bekeng ya go fet Kabinete e ipilet a go batho ka moka go dula ka dikgopolo t a nnete t a Madiba, go akaret a boikgafo bja gagwe bjo bo tiilego mo go toka, tekatekano le go se be le semoraf Global Citizen Festival Mandela 100Kabinete e leboga bakgathatema ka moka ba Global Citizen Festival Mandela 100 woo o swaret we Johannesburg ka Lamorena, 2 Manthole 2018.
trg_text: Cabinet calls on all to stay true to Madiba s ideals, including his unwavering commitment to justice, equality and non-racialis Global Citizen Festival Mandela 100Cabinet thanks all participants of the Global Citizen Festival Mandela 100 held in Johannesburg on Sunday, 2 December 2018.

src_text: O kopant e dikete t a badudi ba lefase, bahlohlelet i, baetapele ba lefase, diopedi le bahuet i go godi a Dinepo t a Tlhabollo yeo e Swarelelago ya Kopanodit haba (UN) go hlompha segopot o sa MandelKabinete e kwelabohloko ka moka bao ba amilwego ke bosenyi ge ba et wa ka stediam E kgala ka bogale mediro ye ya bosenyi gomme e ipilet a go mekgatlo ya phethagat o ya molao go swara basenyi ba Let at i la Lefase la AIDSAfrika Borwa e swere Let at i la Lefase la AIDS ka la 1 Manthole ka fase ga morero:
trg_text: Cabinet approved the publication of the streamlined White Paper on Home Affairs for public commen The White Paper argues that for South Africa to fully realise the potential of the Fourth Industrial Revolution, the DHA must play a critical enabling role in citizen empowerment, inclusive development, efficient government and national securit It is also based on the DHA having sole mandate for the management of official identity and status, international migration, and asylum seekers and refugee The White Paper proposes measures to reduce the fraudulent bank transactions and realise savings due to increased inefficiencie Cabinet approved the submission of the World Intellectual Property Organisation (WIPO) Copyright Treaty (WCT) of 1996 to Parliament for accessio This is a multilateral agreement and a special agreement under the Berne Convention that deals with the protection of the work and rights of their authors in the digital environmen Acceding to the WCT also benefits the South African creative industry, specifically authors of literary and artistic work The WCT is in the best interest of South Africa as it ensures that the country s copyright law will keep pace with technological chang This will afford important protection against piracy for rights holders in the areas of computer programmes and database Cabinet approved the submission of the WIPO Performances and Phonograms Treaty of 1996, to Parliament for accessio This is a multilateral agreement which deals with the rights of performers and producers of phonograms, specifically in the digital environmen This treaty will protect people or organisations that add substantial creative, technical or organisational skill in the process of bringing work to the public and enhance revenue to benefit the Cabinet approved the submission of the Beijing Treaty to Parliament for accessio This is a multilateral agreement, which regulates copyright for audio-visual performances and expands the audio-visual performers

src_text: Lenaneo le lemogile kamogelo ya tlalelet o ya batho ba dimilione t e pedi mo lenaneong la kalafo la antiretroviraAfrika Borwa e na le batho ba go feta 4,2 milione mo kalafong ye, e le
trg_text: Cabinet appreciates government s multidimensional HIV and AIDS programme that has taken decisive steps to bring an end to the epidemi The programme has realised an additional uptake of two million people to the antiretroviral treatment programmSouth Africa has more than 4,2 million people on treatment, making it one of the world s biggest treatment programme The HIV and AIDS campaign continues to make inroads towards changing behaviour, medical treatment and social de-stigmatisatio Cabinet is steadfast in its call on South Africans to get tested so they can know their HIV status, which will help them make informed decisions on preventative measures, treatment, care and suppor UN International Day of Persons with DisabilitiesSouth Africa joined the global community in observing the annual UN International Day of Persons with Disabilities on Monday, 3 DecembeGovernment remains committed to the inclusion and protection of persons with disabilities through dedicated programmes and interventions to ensure access to equal opportunities, as enshrined in the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996.

src_text: go le lengwe la maneneo a magolo go feta ka moka mo lefasen Lesolo la HIV le AIDS le t wela pele go bonagala mo go feto eng maitshwaro, kalafo ya dihlare le go swarwa gabotse ga leag Kabinete e gatelela boipilet o bja yona go maAfrika Borwa go dira diteko gore ba tsebe maemo a bona a HIV, t eo di tla ba thu ago go dira diphetho t a tsebo ka ga mekgwa ya go thibela, kalafo, tlhokomelo le thekg Let at i la Bodit habat haba la Batho bao ba Phelago ka Bogolofadi la UNAfrika Borwa e keteka le set haba sa lefase Let at i la Bodit habat haba la Batho bao ba Phelago ka Bogolofadi la UN la ngwaga le ngwaga ka Mo upologo, 3 MantholMmu o o dula o ikgafile go kakaret o le t hirelet o ya batho bao ba phelago ka bogolofadi ka mananeo a go ikgafa le ditsenogare go kgonthi a phihlelelo go dibaka t a go lekana, bjale ka ge go
trg_text: The mutual evaluation is a peer-review process conducted by international experts from other member countries of the intergovernmental body, the Financial Action Task Force, to assess the effectiveness of the anti-money laundering (AML) and combating of terrorist financing (CFT) system in South Afric The outcomes of the process will assist in strengthening the integrity of the South African financial system by identifying steps to be taken to address any weaknesses in our AML/CFT syste Cabinet approved the recommendations presented to the Department of Basic Education by the Department of Planning, Monitoring and Evaluatio The recommendations flow from the Impact evaluation of the Early Grade Reading Study after two years of intervention The DBE initiated the Early Grade Reading Study in collaboration with various universitie This is a large-scale educational impact evaluation which aims to build evidence about what works to improve the teaching and learning of early grade reading in African languages in the countr The Report will be posted on the DPME websit Cabinet approved the Policy Framework on National Museum The aim is to transform the management and operations of museums in terms of access, redress, equity, nation-building and social cohesio The policy proposes the clustering of museums into new management structures to achieve economies of scale by reducing the number of councilIt also provides for the grading of all the museums according to qualities, scope and significance to enable equitable funding allocation Cabinet approved the National Guide for the Appointment of Persons to Boards and Chief Executive Officers (CEOs) of State-owned and State-controlled Institution The guide provides national principles and good-practice guidelines to promote uniformity in the appointment of person It responds to the Presidential Review Committee on State-owned Entities to promote transparency, accountability and good governance practices in all organs of stat Cabinet approved the 6th progress report by the Inter-Ministerial Task Team on North Wes Cabinet is pleased that visible progress has been made in stabilising the provincial departments in North West and the provision of basic services has been prioritise

src_text: omi wa enet i ya dimel E tla thekgwa ke ditirelo t e di kopanego go swana le go dira dintlophahlo le lot istik Se se dira karolo ya prot eke ya Tlhabollo ya Tsela ya Maputo, yeo e lego tsela ye kgolo ya kgwebo yeo e kgokaganyago Gauteng, Limpopo le Mpumalanga, le Maputo ka Mozambiqu E akaret a, gare ga t e dingwe, ditsela, maemakepe le diporE tla thu a go akgofi a kgolo, ya goket a dipeelet o t a thwii t a gae le t a ka ntle, go katolo a lekala la t welet o le go hlola me omo ka seleten Kabinete e dumelet e go saenwa ga Tumelelano ya Tiri ano ya Ekonomi (EPA) ye e t welago pele le United Kingdom (UK) ge ditaba t a sethekniki di rarollot we le ditaba t a taolo t a ka gare di phethilw Kabinete e amoget e gape go i wa Palamenteng go dumelelwa, Tumelelano ye e thomago EPA gare ga Kopano ya Dikgwebo t a Borwa bja Afrika le Mozambique le U Kabinete e dumelet e phatlalat o ya Sengwalwa sa Makgoraditsela sa Merero ya Selegae ye e mpshafadit wego gore set haba se swayesway Sengwalwa sa Makgoraditsela se bolela gore Afrika Borwa gore e lemoge ka botlalo bokgoni bja Phetogo ya Diintasteri ya Bone, DHA e swanet e go kgatha tema ye bohlokwa ya go kgont ha matlafat o ya badudi, tlhabollo ya kakaret o, mmu o wa bokgoni le t hirelet o ya set hab E theilwe gape go DHA ge e na le taolelo e le tee ya taolo ya boitsebi o bja semmu o le maemo, khudugo ya bodit habat haba, le bao ba nyakago t hirelet o le bafaladi Sengwalwa sa Makgoraditsela se hlagi a mekgwa ya go fokot a bomonet a bja dikgokgano t a ka pankeng le go lemoga dipolokelo ka lebaka la go hloka bokgoni moo go oket egag Kabinete e dumelet e go tli wa ga Tumelelano ya Tokelo ya Ngwalollo (WCT) ya Mokgatlo wa Boithomelo bja Monagano (WIPO) ya 1996 Palamenteng go dumelelwYe ke tumelelano yeo e kopanet wego le tumelelano ya go ikgetha ka fase ga Tumelelano ya Berne yeo e

src_text: Kabinete e amoget e phatlalat o ya Molaokakanywa wa Go t ewa ga naga wo o Mpshafadit wego gore set haba se o swayesway Molaokakanywa woo o mpshafadit we o tlalelet a karolo yeo e abago mabaka ao a kwagalago moo go t ewa ga naga mo kgahlegong ga set haba go ka bago ntle le tef Karolo e matlafat a Molaokakanywa wa go T ewa ga naga wa pele woo o goget wego morago tshepet ong ya palament Molaokakanywa o tla thu a go akgofi a lenaneo la tlhabollo ya naga mola le le ka tlhakong ya melawana ya molaothe Kabinete e dumelet e phatlalat o ya Taolo ya Molaokakanywa wa Diinstitu ene t a Dit helete wa 2018 gore o swayeswaye ke set hab Se se dira karolo ya kaonafat o ya mmu o ya taolo ya lekala la dit helete ka ga mmotlolo wa Twin Peaks gomme wa latela tiragat o ya Molao wa Taolo ya Lekala la Dit helete, 2017 (Molao wa 9 wa 2017) yeo, gare ga t e dingwe, e ikemi edit ego go kgonthi a taolo ye botse ya mmaraka le tshwaro ya badirelwa mo lekaleng la dit helet Molao wa taolo ya mmaraka o ikemi edit e go thibela le go laola ge thibelo e sa atlege, dipoelo t e dimpe di t wa diinstitu eneng t a bao ba sepedi ago dikgwebo t a bona ka mokgwa woo o sa swarego badirelwa gabotse goba ba nyat a go tshepagala ga mebaraka ya dit helete le boitshepo mekgweng ya dit heletMolaokakanywa o tla matlafat a t hirelet o ya badirelwa ka go beakanya molao wa taolo ya mmaraka wo mogolo wo mote Se se tla felelet a ka tiri o ya go se fetogefetoge ya melao ya t hirelet o ya modirelwa go phatlala le lekala la dit helet E aba mokgwa wo motee woo o theilwego me ongwaneng ya go dumelela diinstitu ene ka moka t a dit helete, le go kgonthi a tshwaro le tekolo ye e laolwagSe se tla dumela Bolaodi bja Taolo ya Lekala la Dit helete le lefsa go fihlelela taolelo ya bjona ya go

src_text: MahlokoKabinete e na le Mopresidente Ramaphosa go romeleng molaet a wa mahloko ka go hlokofala ga Molwela tokologo le Motsetamogolo wa naga ya rena nageng ya United Kingdom, Morena Mendi Msimang, ka Mo upologo, 3 Manthole 2018, ka morago ga go lwala sebaka se setelel Kabinete e romela molaet a wa mahloko go balapa, bagwera, balwela tokologo le badiri ani ba Morena Msiman Morena Msimang o filwe Poloko ya Semmu o ya go Ikgetha ya legoro la 1 ya tlhompho ya ma ole go ya ka pholisi ya dipoloko t a semmu o t a Boset haba le t a Profens Ditebogi o3Kabinete e lebogi a Banyana Banyana ka go fihlelela makgaolakgang a Mogopo wa Dinaga t a Afrika wa Basadi wa 2018.

src_text: Ka go dira bjalo ba fihlelet e go tsenela Mogopo wa Lefase wa Basadi wa FIFA nageng ya Franceabinete e lebogi a Ngaka Lindiwe Sidali, yoo a dirilego histori ka go ba mosadi wa mathomo wa moAfrika go ba ngaka ya pelo le maswafo ka nagen Bao Ba Thwet wego Me omongBatho ka moka bao ba thwet wego me omong mangwalo a bona a dithuto a tla tii et wa le go netefalet wa ka maleb Koporasetlhabollo ya Diintasteri (IDC)Morena Tshokolo Nchocho bjalo ka CEO ka kontraka ya mengwaga ye mehlan Maloko a Boto ya t a Boso ya Afrika Borwa: Mohumagadi Nana Magomola (Modulasetulo) Ngaka Phillip David Dexter (Motlat amodulasetulo) Morena David Lefutso Moathbokheiti Derek Jeffrey Block Mohumagadi Sowbakiam Mudly-Padayachie Ngaka Mphekgo Patrick Maila Mohumagadi Feziwe Yolanda Renqe Morena Itani Phaduli Ngaka Owen Peter Muller Horwood Mohumagadi Kelebogile Shirley Moroka-Mosia Morena Jerry Lengoasa (CEO); le Ngaka Tsakani Ngomane (moemedi wa DG ya Kgoro)40.
